defaultPageSection.defaultPageDescription: Page displayed by default when the application loads
defaultPageSection.rememberLastFileDescription: When this option is enabled, the last log file selected for each plugin will be automatically reopened on the next visit.
defaultPageSection.defaultPluginDescription: Log plugin to display by default
defaultPageSection.defaultLogFileDescription: Log file to display by default for this plugin

network.unsavedChangesHint: You have modified settings. Remember to click "Save" to save your changes.
network.leaveEmptyForLocal: Leave empty to use local IP or default values

usersPage.title: User management
usersPage.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
usersPage.timeoutError: Request timed out. Please try again.

regex.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the regex for "{{path}}"?
regex.editorCaptureHint: Use capture groups with parentheses to extract fields
regex.editorTestLinePlaceholder: Paste a log line to test here

dashboard.filesYouOpenWillAppear: Files you open will appear here.

security.unsavedHint: You have modified settings. Remember to click "Save" to save your changes.
security.corsSaveSuccess: CORS configuration saved. A server restart is required to apply changes.
security.jwtWarningBody: For security reasons, set a JWT_SECRET environment variable with a unique, secure value.
security.jwtWarningProduction: In production, use a strong randomly generated secret (minimum 32 characters).
security.maxLoginAttemptsDesc: Number of login attempts allowed before automatic block
security.lockoutDurationDesc: Block duration after exceeding maximum attempts
security.trackingWindowDesc: Period over which failed attempts are counted
security.protectionActiveDesc: Failed login attempts are automatically blocked after {{max}} attempts for {{duration}} minutes.
security.sessionTimeoutDesc: Time before user session expires (applies to new connections only)
security.sessionWarning: Note: The new expiration delay will only apply to new connections. Active sessions will keep their original expiration.
security.sessionStorageNote: Configuration is stored in the database and overrides the JWT_EXPIRES_IN environment variable if set.
security.requireHttpsNote: Usually handled by nginx/reverse proxy. Can be added via Express middleware if needed.
security.rateLimitDesc: Limit requests per IP to prevent DDoS attacks
security.rateLimitNote: Requires installing express-rate-limit and configuring limits per endpoint.
security.blockedListDesc: List of IP addresses and usernames currently blocked due to failed login attempts
security.noBlocked: No IP or account currently blocked
security.corsIntroTitle: CORS configuration for proxy and external access
security.corsIntroDesc: Configure allowed origins, HTTP methods and headers to avoid CORS errors with local proxies or external access.
security.allowedOriginsDesc: List of domains/IPs allowed to access the API. Use * to allow all origins (not recommended in production).
security.noOriginsConfigured: No origin configured. Default values will be used.
security.allowCredentialsDesc: Allow sending cookies and auth headers in cross-origin requests
security.allowedMethodsDesc: HTTP methods allowed for cross-origin requests
security.allowedHeadersDesc: HTTP headers allowed in cross-origin requests

exporter.unsavedHint: You have modified the metrics configuration. Remember to click "Save configuration" to save your changes.
exporter.influxTestSuccess: InfluxDB export successful! Metrics are available.
exporter.errorsAnomaliesNotImplemented: Not implemented — anomaly detection and errors coming soon.
exporter.noActivePlugin: No active log plugin. Enable at least one plugin (Apache, Nginx, NPM, Host System) in Settings → Plugins.
exporter.prometheusDesc: Expose metrics in Prometheus format at /api/metrics/prometheus
exporter.serverPortDesc: Change port if needed. Used for Prometheus metrics URL.
exporter.endpointUrlDesc: Full URL to fetch Prometheus metrics
exporter.prometheusNote: Note: The configured port ({{port}}) is the actual backend server port. Endpoint is available at /api/metrics/prometheus.
exporter.influxDesc: Export metrics in InfluxDB Line Protocol format
exporter.influxNote: Note: InfluxDB export is available at endpoint /api/metrics/influxdb
exporter.exportConfigDesc: Download full application configuration (plugins, settings) as .conf file
exporter.importConfigDesc: Import configuration from a .conf file (replaces current configuration)

database.title: Database
database.defaultDbDesc: LogviewR uses SQLite by default (local file, no external server). Data is stored in a file on disk.
database.tablePluginConfigs: plugin_configs - Plugin configurations (Apache, Nginx, NPM, Host System)
database.tableLogFiles: log_files - Individual log files and their configurations

analysis.title: Log Analysis
analysis.inDevDesc: This feature is under development. It will allow you to analyze your logs to automatically detect common issues, anomalies and trends.
analysis.autoAnalysisDesc: Enable automatic log analysis to detect issues
analysis.anomalyDetectionDesc: Automatically detect abnormal behavior in logs
analysis.smartAlertsDesc: Generate alerts based on pattern analysis

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.inDevDesc: This feature is under development. It will allow you to configure notifications to be alerted when issues are detected in your logs (via webhooks, in-app notifications, etc.).

debug.debugIntro: This section groups useful information for debugging LogviewR: log usage, external configuration and technical metrics.
debug.debugBullet1: Application logs: available via the Logs tab (search, filters, export).
debug.debugBullet2: External configuration: config/logviewr.conf file if mounted, import/export via the Exporter section.
debug.debugBullet3: Prometheus metrics: endpoint /api/metrics/prometheus on the backend.
debug.debugLogsDesc: Enable debug log output in the server console (detailed information about operations)
debug.verboseLogsDesc: Enable very detailed (verbose) log output - requires debug mode to be enabled
debug.debugDisabledMessage: Debug logs are disabled. Enable them to see operation details in the server logs.
debug.debugEnabledMessage: Debug logs are enabled. Server logs will show more detailed information.
debug.clearTitle: Clear memory: removes all logs from the in-memory buffer (max 1000 logs). Useful to free memory after debugging.
debug.clearConfirm:
Are you sure you want to clear memory?

This will remove all logs from the in-memory buffer (max 1000 logs). This action cannot be undone.
debug.warningManyLogs: Warning: Displaying {{count}} logs. This may affect browser performance.
debug.noLogsHint: Use the "Refresh" button to load logs

info.title: Project information
info.tagline: Real-time log visualization application. Support for Apache, Nginx, NPM and system logs.
info.aboutDescription: LogviewR is a web application to view and analyze log files in real time. It connects to your servers (Apache, Nginx, Nginx Proxy Manager, or the host machine) and displays logs with search, filters and themes. Deployable with Docker, with authentication and user management.
info.aboutReadmeBefore: For installation, configuration and full documentation, see the
info.author: Author

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.subtitle: Statistics and detailed information
analytics.pluginStatsDesc: Status and statistics of active log plugins
analytics.enablePluginHint: Enable at least one log plugin to see statistics.
analytics.dbStatsComingSoon: Detailed database statistics will be available soon.

logViewer.totalLinesTooltip: Total number of lines in the file (including empty lines)
logViewer.validLinesTooltip: Number of valid parsed lines (empty lines excluded)
logViewer.filteredLinesTooltip: Number of lines matching search criteria
logViewer.unreadableLinesTooltip: Number of lines that could not be parsed

footer.statsReadableFilesTooltip: Readable log files – Total number of .log (and equivalent) files detected and readable by the application, across all enabled log plugins (System, Apache, Nginx, NPM). Excludes files with denied access or unrecognized format.
footer.statsTotalSizeTooltip: Total size (uncompressed files) – Sum of on-disk size of all log files taken into account, excluding .gz files. Represents space used by « raw » logs available via enabled plugins.
footer.statsGzSizeTooltip: Total size (.gz files) – Sum of the size of gzip-compressed log files. These files are read by the application but counted separately to distinguish compressed from uncompressed logs.

login.title: Login
login.jwtMessage: The JWT secret is not set or uses the default value. This is a significant security risk!
login.jwtStep2: Docker Compose: Add to your .env file or docker-compose.yml:
login.jwtNote: This message will disappear automatically once JWT_SECRET is properly configured and the container restarted.

pluginConfig.title: Configuration {{name}}
pluginConfig.subtitle: Connection settings
pluginConfig.basePathHelp: Path to the directory containing log files
pluginConfig.basePathDefault: Default: /var/log (or /host/logs in Docker). Click "Test" to validate automatically.
pluginConfig.accessPatternHelp: Pattern to detect access log files
pluginConfig.errorPatternHelp: Pattern to detect error log files
pluginConfig.maxLinesHelp: Maximum number of lines to load from each log file
pluginConfig.maxLinesInvalid: Maximum number of lines must be a positive number or zero (0 = unlimited)
pluginConfig.fillRequired: Please fill in all required fields
pluginConfig.saveSuccess: Configuration saved and plugin enabled successfully.
pluginConfig.saveSuccessAfterTest: Configuration saved. Plugin will be enabled after a successful test.
pluginConfig.testSuccess: Test successful! You can now save.
pluginConfig.testSuccessAutoSave: Test successful! Configuration saved and plugin enabled automatically.
pluginConfig.testFailed: Test failed. Check path and permissions.
pluginConfig.defaultsDetectedHelp: You can test directly without changing values. If the test succeeds, the configuration will be saved automatically.
pluginConfig.apiModeControllerHelp: Use the local UniFi Controller API
pluginConfig.apiModeSiteManagerHelp: Use the UniFi Site Manager cloud API (unifi.ui.com)
pluginConfig.apiKeyPlaceholder: Your UniFi Site Manager API key
pluginConfig.apiKeyRequired: API key is required for Site Manager mode
pluginConfig.unifiControllerUrlHelp: Include port (usually 8443). Use a LOCAL admin account (not cloud) to avoid 2FA issues.
pluginConfig.freeboxMessage: The Freebox plugin uses existing Freebox authentication. Configure the connection in Settings or use the Freebox API directly.

pluginOptions.readCompressedHelp: Enables reading compressed log files in .gz (gzip only for now)
pluginOptions.noLimit: No limit - all logs will be loaded
pluginOptions.exclusionFiltersHelp: Configure patterns to automatically exclude files or directories during scan. Patterns support glob syntax (*, ?, **).
pluginOptions.noDetectedFiles: No files detected. Check base path and patterns.

hostSystemFiles.systemBaseHelp: Critical system files detected automatically with validated standard regex
hostSystemFiles.autoDetectedHelp: Files detected automatically with validated standard regex (non-system)

pluginCard.tooltipAllOk: All files are accessible and readable
pluginCard.tooltipTotal: Total number of log files detected
pluginCard.customRegexTooltip: custom regex(es) configured for this plugin

theme.mainThemeDescription: Select the base theme for the interface
theme.speedLabel: Speed (left = slow, right = fast) — multiplier 0.3× to 3.0×
theme.resetParamsTitle: Restore default settings for this animation
theme.cardOpacityDescription: Adjust card and block opacity. Current value: {{percent}}%

nightly.name: Nightly
nightly.description: Very dark theme for night use

neon.name: Neon
neon.description: Neon theme with glow and colored borders

full-animation.name: Full animation
full-animation.description: Animated background with choice of animation (stars, circuit, ribbons, waves)
